description: Table T(n,k) = order of (n,k)-cage (smallest n-regular graph of girth k), n >= 2, k >= 3, read by antidiagonals.
references: P. R. Christopher, Degree monotonicity of cages, Graph Theory Notes of New York, 38 (2000), 29-32.
P. K. Wong, Cages - a survey, J. Graph Theory 6 (1982), 1-22.
links: M. Daven and C. A. Rodger, (k,g)-cages are 3-connected, Discr. Math., 199 (1999), 207-215.
Geoff Exoo, Regular graphs of given degree and girth
G. Exoo and R. Jajcay, Dynamic cage survey, Electr. J. Combin. (2008, 2011).
formula: T(k,g) >= A198300(k,g) with equality if and only if: k = 2 and g >= 3; g = 3 and k >= 2; g = 4 and k >= 2; g = 5 and k = 2, 3, 7 or possibly 57; or g = 6, 8, or 12, and there exists a symmetric generalized g/2-gon of order k - 1. - _Jason Kimberley_, Jan 01 2013
crossrefs: Graphs not required to be regular: A006787, A006856.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 26 2000
extensions: Edited by _Jason Kimberley_, Apr 25 2010, Oct 26 2011, Dec 21 2012, Jan 01 2013
